page.title: 06A Commando raid in 1943/44
page.content:
{Charles Cruickshank,}in his official history of the{German Occupation of } {the Channel Islands,}writes: "The {HARDTACKS}were a series of small scale raids against the coast of France and the Channel Islands to take prisoners and gather intelligence".
{HARDTACK 28}was directed against Jersey on Dec. 25/26. Ten men were landed in the little cove of Petit Port from an MTB (Motor Torpedo Boat) and moved inland up the valley to try and find and capture some Germans. They failed to find any and got little information from some local Jersey people they contacted. During the return to the cove, the leader, Capt. P.A. Ayton was injured by a mine and died later.
